title.rendered: The indie video game platform itch.io assures that NFTs “are a scam”

content.rendered:
The independent digital video game platform itch.io has expressed its opinion about non-expendable assets or NFTs, which it has defined as “a scam” and has pointed out as a means to commit fraud.

“NFTs are a scam. If you believe that they are legitimately useful for anything other than the exploitation of creators, financial scams and the destruction of the planet, we ask you to re-evaluate your priorities in life,” said this centered store in titles without digital rights management (DRM) on Twitter.

itch.io has also accused NFT-backing companies of wanting to profit from these virtual creations, “especially given the now easily accessible discourse on NFT issues.”

“They only care about their own benefit and the opportunity for wealth at the expense of others,” added the platform in a thread on the social network, where it ensures that non-fungible tokens “are a scam” and the origin of fraudulent actions in Internet.

It should be remembered that the itch.io PC application, which has video games such as Rogue64 (C64), dordle, Dungeon Wizards or Apocalich, has been included in the Epic Games Store launcher since April of last year.

Precisely, this company, developer of Fortnite, announced in October 2021 that it was opening the doors of its digital store to video games in which ‘blockchain’ technology is used.

Epic Games has not been the only one to position itself in favor of NFTs, as others have joined such as Ubisoft -with the creation of Quartz, a platform for playable NFT files for its games in the form of unique cosmetic elements- and Square Enix.

In the traditional New Year’s message, the president and representative director of the Japanese company, Yosuke Matsuda, highlighted the benefits of ‘blockchain’ technology in video games and valued the influence of virtual assets in the sector.

However, the manager insisted on the need to maintain caution in this regard, due to the “trade of digital goods based on NFTs with somewhat speculative nuances.”

For its part, Valve maintains in its section of conditions for developers who wish to publish games on Steam the prohibition of sharing “applications built with ‘blockchain’ technology that emit or allow the exchange of cryptocurrencies or NFT”.
